item.title: Pakistani Taliban Attack Rival Commander
item.description: The suicide attack in the country’s northwest killed at least 15 people, but left the commander only lightly wounded.
item.dc:creator: By SALMAN MASOOD

item.title: Letter From Europe: Russia Redraws Lines of Diplomacy
item.description: Moscow's maneuvers in the negotiations over Syria set up a rivalry with Washington, while leaving Europe largely sidelined in the region.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: October 3
item.description: A girl practicing the traditional dance form of Garba ahead of the nine-day Navratri festival in Ahmedabad, Gujarat.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: A girl practicing 'Garba', a dance form, in Ahmedabad, Gujarat. The traditional dance is performed in western India during the nine-day Navratri festival.

item.title: Scores of Migrants Dead After Boat Sinks Off Sicily
item.description: Nearly 100 passengers died and more than 200 were missing after a boat carrying an estimated 500 migrants from Libya apparently caught fire and sank.
item.dc:creator: By GAIA PIANIGIANI
item.media:description: The bodies of migrants who drowned after their boat sank while crossing from Africa on Thursday were lined up in the harbor of Lampedusa, Italy.

item.title: Leader of Far-Right Party in Greece Is Jailed
item.description: Nikos Michaloliakos, the leader of the Golden Dawn party, was ordered held pending trial on charges of setting up a criminal organization.
item.dc:creator: By NIKI KITSANTONIS

item.title: The Lede: Video of Israel and Iran Sparring at U.N.
item.description: Following an address to the United Nations from Israel’s prime minister that was an extended attack on the credibility of Iran’s new president, an Iranian diplomat exercised his country’s right to reply.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: India Ink: Former Bihar Chief Minister Gets Five Years in Jail
item.description: A court on Thursday sentenced Lalu Prasad to five years in jail on charges of corruption.
item.dc:creator: By HARI KUMAR
item.media:description: Lalu Prasad, former chief minister of Bihar, center, arriving at a court in Ranchi, Jharkhand, on Monday.

item.title: India Ink: The Fuss About India’s Oscar Entry
item.description: The controversy over India’s official selection for the Academy Awards.
item.dc:creator: By SNIGDHA POONAM
item.media:description: Actor Irrfan Khan at the screening of his film "The Lunchbox" at the 38th Toronto International Film Festival in Canada on Sept. 8.

item.title: Japan and U.S. Agree to Broaden Military Alliance
item.description: The agreement, which includes a new missile defense system in Japan and a pledge to coordinate on cyberthreats, signals the United States’s increased military, economic and diplomatic focus on Asia.
item.dc:creator: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and MARTIN FACKLER

item.title: Signs Suggest North Korea Has Restarted Nuclear Reactor
item.description: North Korea’s main nuclear complex was discharging hot wastewater in a sign that it has restarted an old nuclear reactor to help make bombs.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: Indonesia’s Top Judge Held in Corruption Case
item.description: The arrest of the chief justice of the Constitutional Court is the latest in a series of high-profile corruption inquires in a country that has been struggling to deal with the problem.
item.dc:creator: By JOE COCHRANE
item.media:description: Akil Mochtar, the chief justice of the Indonesia's Constitutional Court, during an interview in April.

item.title: Kerry Says Talks With Iran Will Not Be Based on Trust
item.description: In his first comments since Israel warned the United States about negotiating with Tehran, the secretary of state expressed wariness over such talks.
item.dc:creator: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER

item.title: The Caucus: Obama ‘Hugely Impressed’ by Pope Francis
item.description: President Obama said in an interview that the pope seemed to be “somebody who lives out the teachings of Christ.”
item.category: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
United States Conference of Catholic Bishops
item.dc:creator: By LAURIE GOODSTEIN

item.title: Juba Journal: On Fashion Runway, South Sudan Takes Steps Toward a National Identity
item.description: With her fashion shows, Akuja de Garang is trying to change perceptions of South Sudan, including those of its own people, even as interethnic tension and violence persist.
item.category: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
item.dc:creator: By NICHOLAS KULISH
item.media:credit: Camille Lepage for The New York Times
item.media:description: A living room was used as a modeling studio in August for a fashion show in Juba, South Sudan’s capital.

item.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Iran’s President Responds to Netanyahu
item.description: President Hassan Rouhani of Iran dismissed the verbal assault on his credibility by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel the day before at the United Nations General Assembly.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Libya: Mob Attacks Russian Embassy
item.description: An armed mob broke into the Russian Embassy compound in the Libyan capital, Tripoli, a day after a Russian woman was accused of killing a Libyan Air Force pilot, Libyan officials said.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | Asia: Evidence North Korea Restarted Reactor
item.description: New satellite imagery offers further signs that North Korea has restarted a nuclear reactor capable of producing plutonium for bombs, a United States research institute said.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Mutiny Halts Italian Gambit by Berlusconi
item.description: The former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi’s attempt to resuscitate his endangered political career by bringing down the government instead provoked a rebellion in his own party.
item.dc:creator: By JIM YARDLEY
item.media:description: Silvio Berlusconi, center, had to reverse himself on Wednesday and pledge support for the Italian government he failed to topple.

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: The Hague: Warrant Issued for Kenyan
item.description: The International Criminal Court has issued an arrest warrant for a man suspected of tampering with witnesses in the war crimes case against William Ruto, Kenya’s deputy president.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: France: Court Throws Out Cases Claiming Racial Profiling by Police
item.description: A court in Paris threw out lawsuits that claimed illegal racial profiling by the police engaged in public identity checks and pat-downs.
item.dc:creator: By SCOTT SAYARE

item.title: Weapons Inspection Team Begins Work in Syria
item.description: A team of weapons inspectors has begun the groundwork for destroying Syria’s chemical arms, but it is unclear how it will navigate the complex task amid a civil war.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: A fighter with the rebel Free Syrian Army in the remains of a government building Wednesday in Aleppo.

item.title: Missed Opportunity in Syria Haunts U.N. Official
item.description: Angela Kane, the high representative for disarmament affairs, regrets a lost chance to investigate a possible chemical weapons attack in March amid disagreements with Syria over access.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE and SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: Cameron Rallies Tories as Labour Attacks Pile Up
item.description: Prime Minister David Cameron attacked the Labour leader, Ed Miliband, for his left-wing policies, after the Daily Mail called his father an unreconstructed Marxist “who hated Britain.”
item.dc:creator: By STEVEN ERLANGER and STEPHEN CASTLE
item.media:description: Prime Minister David Cameron at the Conservative Party conference on Wednesday.

item.title: Case Against Greek Far-Right Party Draws Critics
item.description: Efforts to “eradicate” the Golden Dawn party have raised questions about legality and concerns about drawing sympathy for the neo-fascist group.
item.dc:creator: By LIZ ALDERMAN

item.title: Listening Post : Another Shutdown Victim: U.S. Efforts to Offset China
item.description: By forcing President Obama to cancel a visit to Malaysia and the Philippines, the impasse is spoiling Mr. Obama’s show of support for two countries that have labored under China’s shadow.
item.category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER
